intro: Ophryosporus mandonii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces bright yellow flowers, which bloom in the spring and early summer. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Ophryosporus mandonii is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrublands.
